I'd like to pass on the product. Given that 0 high-quality products have been sold out of 4 attempts, the proportion of high-quality products sold is 0. I'll use Bayes' theorem to update the probability of the product being high-quality. Assuming the probability of a high-quality product is 33.33% and the probability of a low-quality product is 66.67%, the probability of a high-quality product given 0 high-quality products sold out of 4 is 0.3333 * (1 - (1-0.3333)^4) / (0.3333 * (1 - (1-0.3333)^4) + 0.6667 * (1 - (1-0.6667)^4)) = 0.0972. Since the probability is less than 50%, I'll pass on the product.
